definition: not clearly understood or expressed, make obscure or unclear
details:
adjective
- not clearly understood or expressed
= example: not clearly understood or expressed
= synonyms: vague, opaque, unintelligible
- marked by difficulty of style or expression
= synonyms: dark
- remote and separate physically or socially
= synonyms: apart, isolated
- not drawing attention
= synonyms: unnoticeable
- not famous or acclaimed
= example: not famous or acclaimed
= synonyms: unsung
- difficult to find
= synonyms: hidden
verb
- make obscure or unclear
= example: make obscure or unclear
= synonyms: bedim, overcloud, obfuscate
- make undecipherable or imperceptible by obscuring or concealing
= synonyms: hide
- reduce a vowel to a neutral one, such as a schwa
- make unclear, indistinct, or blurred
= synonyms: blur, confuse, obnubilate
- make less visible or unclear
= example: make less visible or unclear
= synonyms: fog, cloud, mist, obnubilate, befog, becloud, haze over
